Sentence: It is Ralph, Jay's alcoholic brother
Ralph tells Jay that he (Ralph) had better come over soon because their father, Grampa Follet, has had another heart attack
Jay feels that the clearly drunk Ralph may be exaggerating
Meanwhile, Jay has arrived at the farm and is now angry that he (Jay) made the trip: sure enough, Ralph greatly exaggerated their father's condition
Andrew calls Ralph to alert Jay's side of the family about the death
Ralph feels terrible, and offers to be the undertaker, but Mary has already brought Jay to a different undertaker
